title: Active-duty Boston police officer dies after more than 30 years with department, BPD says
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Boston police officer Scott MacIsaac died of cancer after over 30 years in the department, BPD announced.
MacIsaac joined Boston Police Department in 1995, serving in West Roxbury and multiple districts over his career.
Officer MacIsaac received commendations for actions during the Boston Marathon bombings and life-saving incidents.

title: Bruins’ Jeremy Swayman gets into goalie fight with Andrei Vasilevskiy in outdoor game
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jeremy Swayman and Andrei Vasilevskiy fought during the Bruins vs. Lightning outdoor game at Raymond James Stadium.
Both goalies received five-minute major penalties for fighting and additional penalties for leaving the crease.
The fight occurred with the Bruins leading 5-2; the game ended with the Lightning narrowing the score to 5-4.

title: Suspect charged with murder after mother and son shot to death in Fall River
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Arlington Cole, 54, is charged with two counts of murder after a shooting in Fall River, Massachusetts.
The victims, Elizabeth Almeida, 54, and her son Nicholas Almeida, 25, died from gunshot wounds on Barnes Street.
Cole, who was dating Elizabeth Almeida, was found at the scene and faces additional charges for firearm possession.

title: Dozens rescued by N.H. fire officials after ski lift malfunctions in bitter cold
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Nearly 60 skiers were rescued from a malfunctioning ski lift at Dartmouth Skiway in Lyme Center, New Hampshire.
Rescuers from fire departments in Lyme, Hanover, and Thetford coordinated the evacuation in under an hour and a half.
One skier was hospitalized, while others were checked and returned to the lodge, according to the Lyme Fire Department.

title: Former Mass. state senator receives more prison time for fraud
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Former Mass. State Sen. Dean Tran sentenced to 11 more months for obstructing justice and lying to federal investigators.
Tran's additional sentence will run 10 months concurrently with his current 18-month sentence; he'll serve 1 extra month afterwards.
Tran pleaded guilty to revisions of a fraudulent pandemic unemployment letter, falsely claiming his sister was the sole author.

title: Bruins’ Fraser Minten named NHL Rookie of the Month
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Fraser Minten named NHL Rookie of the Month after scoring eight goals and 14 points in January.
Minten, 21, was acquired from the Maple Leafs and is the first Bruins Rookie of the Month since 2022.
The Bruins, missing two top centers, will rely on Minten in the Stadium Series against the Lightning.

title: 7 people are presumed dead after their Gloucester fishing boat sank. Here’s how they’ll be remembered.
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: The Lily Jean, a 72-foot fishing vessel, sank Friday off Gloucester, leaving seven crew members presumed dead.
The U.S. Coast Guard conducted a 24-hour search covering 1,000 square miles but suspended efforts, finding one unresponsive body.
Victims include Captain Gus Sanfilippo, Sean Therrien, John Paul Rousanidis, Jada Samitt, Paul Beal, Paul Beal Jr., and Freeman Short.

title: Bruins dress as colonial Patriots ahead of Stadium Series game in Tampa
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Bruins dressed as colonial-era Patriots for Sunday's Stadium Series game against the Lightning in Tampa.
Players wore tricorne hats and shoe buckles, celebrating Boston’s historical ties at Raymond James Stadium.
Bruins used costumes from Boston Costume, allowing players to add personal touches to their outfits.

title: Red Sox reportedly trade pitcher Jordan Hicks to White Sox
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Red Sox trade Jordan Hicks and pitching prospect David Sandlin to White Sox, per ESPN's Jeff Passan.
Boston receives minor league pitcher Gage Ziehl and sends cash to Chicago in the exchange.
Hicks struggled with an 8.20 ERA in 18.2 innings for Boston during the 2025 season.

title: Photos: Something in the Way music fest at Roadrunner, Day 1
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: 'Something in the Way' festival at Roadrunner features two dozen indie bands over two days.
Bands such as The Hotelier, Momma, and Explosions in the Sky performed on the first day.
Boston.com photographer Ben Stas captured images of the event, highlighting the vibrant indie music scene.
